      • main

      • circlePerimeter

        public static void circlePerimeter(int steps)
        The formula for the n-th step side length: c(n) = √(2+ √(4 - c(n-1)²)) Note1: the most accurate value is at step 14 - 3.141592654807589; MacOS calculator gives 3.14159265. Britannica gives this: 3.141592653589793238462643383279502884197 step - 13; l = 3.8349519451455667E-4; s = 3.1415926334632482; step - 14; l = 1.9174759856003352E-4; s = 3.141592654807589; step - 15; l = 9.58737989905156E-5; s = 3.1415926453212153; step - 16; l = 4.793689891625549E-5; s = 3.1415926073757197; step - 17; l = 2.3968451774136908E-5; s = 3.1415929109396727; step - 18; l = 1.198423051908566E-5; s = 3.141594125195191; Note2: Looks like double float precision is hitting its limit around step 14. It collapses at step 29: step - 28; l = 1.4901161193847656E-8; s = 4.0; step - 29; l = 0.0; s = 0.0;
        Parameters:
        steps -
        result -

        The formula probability distribution for chord > a (side of equilateral triangle) distribution = -2/3Δr2 + 1/2 [-2Δr↑2 + 1/3Δr + 1/3] -> looks wrong]
